messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]early puberty was deschooling--TV and	Video |Limits
messages.msgSnippet: ... Do Asians whose diet has a great deal more soy than Americans could get without working real hard at it, enter puberty early? Joyce [Non-text portions of
messages.messageBody:
on 11/15/01 12:44 PM, Tanya Barrera at tanyab2@... wrote:

> I recently read that there may be a link between soy & early puberty
> in girls. I don't remember the source but I'm sure a search would show
> something if you want more info.

Do Asians whose diet has a great deal more soy than Americans could get
without working real hard at it, enter puberty early?

Joyce



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]early puberty was deschooling--TV and Video |Limits
messages.msgSnippet: Mine completely eschewed tofu and other soy products until about a month ago, execpt some soy sauce... if there is a link between early puberty and Trader
messages.messageBody:
Mine completely eschewed tofu and other soy products until about a month
ago, execpt some soy sauce... if there is a link between early puberty
and Trader Ming's vegetarian gyoza that might explain it..

Dar

On Thu, 15 Nov 2001 11:44:20 -0600 Tanya Barrera <tanyab2@...>
writes:
> I recently read that there may be a link between soy & early puberty
> in girls. I don't remember the source but I'm sure a search would
> show something if you want more info.
>
> Tanya B
>
> In a message dated 11/15/01 12:22:26, freeform@... writes:
>
> << My daughter is 8 and beginning puberty - not enough to need a
> bra, but
> some. Actually, her development started at 7. >>
>
> Did those of you who have daughters who are experiencing early
> puberty
> breastfed|? Delay solids|? just curious. |||Kimme

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]early puberty was deschooling--TV and Video |Limits
messages.msgSnippet: I recently read that there may be a link between soy & early puberty in girls. I don t remember the source but I m sure a search would show something if you
messages.messageBody:
I recently read that there may be a link between soy & early puberty in girls. I don't remember the source but I'm sure a search would show something if you want more info.

Tanya B

In a message dated 11/15/01 12:22:26, freeform@... writes:

<< My daughter is 8 and beginning puberty - not enough to need a bra, but
some. Actually, her development started at 7. >>

Did those of you who have daughters who are experiencing early puberty
breastfed|? Delay solids|? just curious. |||Kimme



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]early puberty was deschooling--TV and Video |Limits
messages.msgSnippet: Breastfed for almost 4 years, started solids at maybe 6-8 months, but not much, just a taste here and there.. she is marvelously healthy and allergy- and
messages.messageBody:
Breastfed for almost 4 years, started solids at maybe 6-8 months, but not
much, just a taste here and there.. she is marvelously healthy and
allergy- and asthma-free, compared to me, but OTOH she has always done
everything early and has always been big for her age - not fat, but big.

Dar, who didn't mean to reply twice the first time :-/
